Rubinius

Use Ruby™

1.2.3

The following is an alphabetical list of projects that leverage the excellent technology found in Rubinius, from the bytecode interpreter to the JIT compiler to the various tools written in Ruby, like the bytecode compiler.

If your project uses Rubinius, please submit a patch to add it to our list!

Akin

github.com/vic/akin

An Akin programming language optimized for fun.

Atomy

github.com/vito/atomy

The Atomy programming language.

Brainfuck

github.com/txus/brainfuck

A Brainfuck implementation.

Capuchin

github.com/matthewd/capuchin

A JavaScript implementation.

Convinius

github.com/rkh/convinius

Convenience library for Rubinius-only projects.

Ez-Scheme

github.com/ezmobius/ez-scheme

A Scheme.

Fancy

github.com/bakkdoor/fancy

The Fancy Programming Language - Fancy is a dynamic, object-oriented programming language heavily inspired by Smalltalk, Ruby and Erlang.

Lupin

github.com/twisol/lupin

An implementation of Lua.

Pegarus

github.com/brixen/pegarus

An implementation of LPEG.

Poison

github.com/brixen/poison

An interpretation of _why’s Potion programming language.

Rasp

github.com/matthewd/rasp

A VBScript implementation.

Reak

github.com/rkh/Reak

An implementation of ANSI Smalltalk.

Syme

github.com/brixen/syme

An implementation of Newspeak.

Typhon

github.com/vic/typhon

A Python implementation.

  • Fork Rubinius on github
